file_content.text: No need to worry, we'll turn things around. Just need to turn on the old Imperial charm.
Back so soon? I expected Karagga to prolong negotiations for at least a week.
I take it your message had Karagga quivering in his juices like a namana custard?
Our discussion was brief.
Was Karagga suitably impressed with our offering?
The Hutt's mind was made up before we arrived.
Karagga wasted no time trying to kill us.
I tried to warn you....
Ambassador, you can be helpful or be quiet.
He what? Of all the suicidal--
I knew Karagga was overconfident, I didn't know he was stupid!
Did he say anything? Any indication why he's bent on destroying our alliance?
I pried this from his cold grubby hands.
This was all I found.
He parted with his life... and his secrets.
This may tell us something.
He coughed this up, along with a lung or two.
His diary might tell you.
He kept this close. I'm sure he would have been reluctant to part with it, had he been in a position to argue.
Find your answers with this.
He seemed to think this was our fault--he was raving about our betrayal.
Paranoia, if I had to guess.
Karagga had some choice words for the Empire. Seems like he was laying the blame on you guys.
He was mad about something.
Before or after he dropped us in his rancor pit?
I just wanted to stay alive.
His records can tell you more than I can.
Karagga's personal data key? Let's give it a look, shall we?
I, ah, don't think you should--
Please don't kill me.
Finances, blackmail, favorite recipes... Karagga's most closely guarded secrets laid bare.
Now this explains a lot. The Hutts weren't just taking territory, they were losing it.
Karagga wasn't expanding, he was hanging onto anything he could.
So the Hutts are retreating.
He wasn't a graceful loser, and he had to lay the blame somewhere.
Why would Karagga turn on his only ally when he's losing ground?
It doesn't explain his ambush.
He was blaming us for the attacks.
Has the Republic begun attacking the Hutts as well?
Who are they fighting?
No mention of the Republic, but there's quite a bit about the Empire.
It seems Karagga executed my predecessor after Imperial ships reportedly invaded a world housing his favorite holiday estate.
Preposterous, of course. The Minister of War would have never approved that, but it's one of the more believable accounts described here.
I'll listen to anything to learn who's behind all this.
Are there other clues?
It's pure chaos.
There's something more farfetched than the Imperial fleet bombing Karagga's vacation spots?
That's the best explanation?
Karagga didn't just imagine Imperial ships attacking his territory.
Don't dismiss the possibility.
Remnants of Malgus the Betrayer's forces, perhaps? That only explains a fraction of these reports, though.
A mass exodus from Sriluur, Cartel forces turning on each other in blind panic, a monster swallowing fleets whole over Cyborrea.
Either the survivors of these attacks were incredibly imaginative or they've all gone insane.
The deluded ramblings of minds drowned in fear. Fear is a Sith's weapon.
This is terror in action.
The last thing we need is another would-be Emperor.
The Force can bend minds to the will of its wielder, though few could unleash it on such a scale.
There are powers at work here.
Respectfully, I hope your instincts are wrong about this, my lord.
You don't make up stories for a crime boss, you run and hope they don't send someone like me to find you.
Hutts don't take excuses well.
Karagga took bad news... badly.
That does make sense....
The bizarre reports are too widespread to be a coincidence. Someone is sowing panic through the Cartel forces.
This is sabotage.
Something's definitely afoot.
Rumors and hearsay are useless. Show me something I can act on.
Find concrete evidence.
There isn't much to be done about it now. It will take weeks to comb through all this data.
I'll disseminate Karagga's files to the right people. If anything comes of it, you will be the first to know.
Bore someone else with the details. Are we finished with this fiasco?
I've heard enough.
Our hopes of a quick resolution died with Karagga, but the Hutts will be too busy vying for his position to pose any threat.
That should give us time to sort out a new plan of action.
In the meantime, I'll see that some of Karagga's tribute sees its way into your possession. You've done the Empire a great service today.
Ambassador. We need to have a little chat.
Always happy to, uh, help....
I'm sure you'll have this misunderstanding cleared up in no time.
The embodiment of our great Emperor's wrath.
If you don't mind my saying, the Dark Council suits you, my lord.
Five systems. That's what the Republic offered for your extradition. How many hunters can weigh their worth in stars?
I collaborated with Intelligence for thirty-two operations, but I never had the privilege of working with a Cipher. Ex-Cipher, I suppose.
I'm glad you could make it.
Ambassador Rove, Imperial Diplomatic Service. It's regrettable we couldn't meet under better circumstances.
What happened was... unpleasant.
Hmm? Oh yes, this is Ambassador Grub, the Hutt Cartel's most recently appointed obstacle to our negotiations.
They mock us by sending this pathetic creature.
This wretch is an ambassador?
I'm glad I'm not the only one to think so.
Some time enjoying our hospitality will make him more accommodating.
He'll become cooperative soon.
Say the word and I'll clear it.
Need him removed?
I appreciate the thought, but it wouldn't solve our problem.
It's an insult. They aren't even trying to disguise it.
This is a slap in the face.
Their behavior has become quite brazen.
Mind your manners, Rove. It's the one thing expected of you.
Do not insult our guest.
I--apologize, my lord, but he wasn't sent here to facilitate a discussion.
I suspect he had as little desire to wind up in this position as you did.
You should try to get along.
I'm sure you're right. It would just be nice if the Hutts at least pretended to cooperate.
Don't take it personal, that's what passes for friendly to Imperials.
Imps have no respect.
I don't appreciate being strung along. You can understand that.
Perhaps you've forgotten you're here to improve relations.
Don't be petty.
With respect, we won't see results by coddling a ploy functionary.
Grub doesn't strike me as the uncooperative type.
This man is an obstacle?
It isn't his willingness that's our problem.
Karagga the Unyielding is living up to his name. Fatally expelling our ambassador is just one of many worrisome moves he's made recently.
Anyone foolish enough to raise his hand against the Empire should prepare to lose it.
Insolence must be punished.
I appreciate your outrage, my lord, but we must choose our enemies wisely. Overlooking the affront may be for the best.
I take it your predecessor isn't the only casualty of Karagga's tantrums?
So Karagga's on a rampage.
No, my lord, and I fear this was more calculated than temperamental.
Head in a box is as honest as a Hutt gets.
At least he's straightforward.
I'm more worried by what isn't being said.
Was this an act of war? Has he attacked other Imperials?
He killed an ambassador?
Not yet, but Karagga's marshaling his forces for something big.
Did Karagga catch your predecessor spying on him?
Was the ambassador at fault?
Ambassador Unar's orders weren't that aggressive. That doesn't mean he wasn't trying to hide something.
Who is this "Karagga the Unyielding"?
Tell me about Karagga.
Supreme Mogul of the Hutt Cartel, Unquestioned Ruler of the Hutt Domain, Paragon of the Hutt species....
That's sufficient, Grub.
Karagga is the most powerful Hutt in the galaxy, and he rules the Hutt Cartel with an iron fist.
By his decree, the Hutt Cartel has invaded no less than ten of its neighboring systems in the last month.
Not invaded... um... incorporated. Those systems had been such good partners... they were invited to join the family!
Regardless, Karagga is expanding Hutt Space for the first time in centuries, and he's been conveniently unreachable when the Empire needs its allies the most.
What's there to gain by cutting ties with the Empire?
But, why?
Either he's leaving us to hang in the war, or he's switched sides.
That is... that is... not true?
Care to explain this, Ambassador?
I'd like answers, Grub.
I'm sure my master... simply doesn't wish to bother you with our humble affairs.
Karagga's grabbing as much territory as he can before he has to fight us for it.
These are war preparations.
No--no, I'm sure... I'm sure, uh--
Whatever his reasons, we need to change Karagga's mind. I want to send an envoy to renew the Grand Mogul's confidence in us.
Oh! Oh, no, you mustn't. Karagga the Unyielding wishes not to be disturbed! Please! I--I'll hear any concerns... please?
This is my message. [Kill Grub]
Karagga will learn the price of defiance.
Karagga will learn to never trifle with a Dark Lord.
This'll be a message the Hutt'll understand.
I'll make the Hutt wish he'd kept things civil.
Give what we get, eh? Right, we can't afford to show weakness at a time like this.
I'll negotiate with Karagga.
He needs to be reminded of what our alliance has to offer.
Appealing to his decadence will make things easier.
He's just trying to put the squeeze on you. I'll take care of it.
He suspects he can get a better deal now that we need him. I'll find out what he really wants.
Excellent, I'll have this tribute loaded onto the shuttle by the time you're prepared to depart.
I'm sure Karagga will come around once he sees how serious we are about this alliance.
With a Sith of your station personally involved, how could Karagga refuse?
Given your experience dealing with Hutts, I'm sure this'll be taken care of in no time.
You'll have the Hutt Cartel marching to our tune in no time.
Pleasure to have you aboard, make yourself at home.
And you keep no less impressive company. We're certainly ready to show that the Empire means business.
